description: From bat (“to improve"; as in "battle, batten”) +‎ -ful.

adjectives.description: batful (comparative more batful, superlative most batful)

entries.meaning: (dialectal or obsolete) Rich; fertile, as in reference to land or soil.
examples: The batfull pastures fenc’t, and most with quickset mound,
The sundry sorts of soyle, diversitie of ground;
